projects.title: particle simulation with random movement
projects.info: webgl, three.js, javascript, a lot of math i probably should have already known
projects.writeup: given a particle count and a speed factor, particles will move in a randomly generated path. not sure why i made this.

paint4me: an online painting app
projects.writeup: i was bored and wanted to make something cute.

projects.title: news article analyzer: sentiment analysis using ibm watson
projects.info: watson api, natural language understanding, team hacking
projects.writeup: during my internship at ibm, we got to participate in a hackathon with access to various ibm watson apis. we decided to analyze a body of text based on sentiment and keywords. my role in the team was server-side programming, including handling api calls and responses, and returning data to the frontend.

projects.title: mealhop: a food ordering coordinater for your chat group
projects.info: javascript, cisco spark api, our very first hackathon
projects.writeup: i participated in my first hackathon in 2017 with two friends. we wanted to utilize the cisco spark api to create a simple project that we could comfortably finish within 36 hours, so we built a chat bot for cisco spark that allowed groups to coordinate lunch orders. this was our first real experience with javascript, and it was a very fun but also educational experience.

projects.title: PLEASE DON'T CLICK ME spotify analytics: a web app to view your spotify listening data
projects.info: javascript, spotify api, express, node.js, pug
